fields.quote: If I hadn't heard rock and roll on the radio, I would have had no idea there was life on this planet.
fields.author: LOU REED, liner notes, Peel Slowly and See

fields.quote: Rock 'n' Roll might not solve your problems, but it does let you dance all over them.
fields.author: PETE TOWNSHEND, attributed, Teach Like Your Hair's on Fire

fields.quote: Rock 'n' roll smells phony and false. It is sung, played and written, for the most part, by cretinous goons. And, by means of its almost imbecilic reiteration, and sly, lewd and in plain fact, dirty lyrics ... it manages to be the martial music of every side-burned delinquent on the face of the earth.
fields.author: FRANK SINATRA, attributed, Taboo Tunes: A History of Banned Bands & Censored Songs

fields.quote: Shall I tell you what rock and roll is?... It's restless and rude. It's defiant and daring. It's a fist shaken at age. It's a voice that often screams out questions because the answers are always changing.
fields.author: NORA ROBERTS, Public Secrets

fields.quote: Apparently rock and roll liberated the pelvis and it hasn't been the same since.
fields.author: EMMA THOMPSON, The Sense and Sensibility Screenplay and Diaries: Bringing Jane Austen's Novel to Film

fields.quote: Life is a disease. The only cure is rock 'n' roll.
fields.author: ANONYMOUS

fields.quote: Just let me hear some of that rock and roll musicAny old way you choose itIt's got a backbeat, you can't lose itAny old time you use itIt's gotta be rock roll musicIf you want to dance with me
fields.author: CHUCK BERRY, "Rock and Roll Music"

fields.quote: "Rock and Roll" is the tribal war cry of the 20th Century.
fields.author: DAVE THOMPSON, 1000 Songs that Rock Your World

fields.quote: Rock and roll is a single, monolithic beast, manufactured solely for profit and the shattering of refined eardrums.
fields.author: ROBERT PALMER, "Folk, Popular, Jazz, and Classical Elements in New Orleans", Folk Music and Modern Sound

fields.quote: Rock and roll music, if you like it, if you feel it, you can't help but move to it. That's what happens to me. I can't help it.
fields.author: ELVIS PRESLEY, attributed, The Book of Rock Lists

fields.quote: We're more popular than Jesus now; I don't know which will go first -- rock and roll or Christianity.
fields.author: JOHN LENNON, Evening Standard, March 4, 1966

fields.quote: Rock and roll is not one music but many.
fields.author: ROBERT PALMER, "Folk, Popular, Jazz, and Classical Elements in New Orleans", Folk Music and Modern Sound

fields.quote: Rock and roll is the hamburger that ate the world. Electric rock music creeps, like chemical seasoning, into everything. Rock and roll is mother's little helper on the housewife radio, plays across film sound-tracks and sells packaged goods.
fields.author: PETER YORK, Style Wars

fields.quote: Rock and Roll is inclusive. It welcomes rockers of all races, religions, ages, ethnic backgrounds, alternative lifestyles.
fields.author: MAURY DEAN, Rock and Roll

fields.quote: You know her life was saved by rock 'n' rollYeah rock 'n' rollOoh, Despite all the computationsYou know you could just dance to the rock 'n' roll station
fields.author: THE VELVET UNDERGROUND, "Rock and Roll"

fields.quote: For me rock and roll is about the freedom to express yourself very loudly.
fields.author: BOB GRUEN, "Photographer Bob Gruen: Everything about the Rolling Stones is rock and roll", Page Six, December 4, 2015

fields.quote: The first day I can remember looking into a mirror and being able to stand what I saw was the day I had a guitar in my hand.
fields.author: BRUCE SPRINGSTEEN, Bruce Springsteen Talking

fields.quote: I wanted to make the greatest rock record that I'd ever heard, and I wanted it to sound enormous and I wanted it to grab you by your throat and insist that you take that ride, insist that you pay attention, not to just the music, but just to life, to feeling alive, to being alive.
fields.author: BRUCE SPRINGSTEEN, interview, Rolling Stone, August 25, 2015

fields.quote: Music is just a younger game. You have to go on tour and live in a van where you don't wash. If you're above 30 you can't. If you're over 30 and you're trying to still be in a rock band, you're just pathetic.
fields.author: JOHN LEE, interview, IndieWire, September 9, 2013

fields.quote: If you tried to give rock and roll another name, you might call it Chuck Berry.
fields.author: JOHN LENNON, The Mike Douglas Show, 1972

fields.quote: Rock and roll ain't nothing but jazz with a hard backbeat.
fields.author: KEITH RICHARDS, Life

fields.quote: Rock 'n' roll is tribal, the group being a commercial version of the neighborhood street clique with the same self-aggrandizing, illusory worldview and paranoiac obsessions.
fields.author: IAN SVENONIUS, Supernatural Strategies for Making a Rock 'n' Roll Group

fields.quote: Rock 'n' Roll: The most brutal, ugly, desperate, vicious form of expression it has been my misfortune to hear.
fields.author: FRANK SINATRA, attributed, Frank Sinatra: The Man, the Music, the Legend

fields.quote: We built this city on rock 'n' roll.
fields.author: STARSHIP, "We Built This City"

fields.quote: Glam rockers unquestionably used their performances of queer identities to provoke and rebel against the status quo in a way that roughly parallels earlier rockers' use of black music and identities. But there is also a crucial difference: whereas black music has always been central to the rock imaginary, queer identities were relegated to its periphery until glam came along.... Even though it is arguable that rock is equally steeped in a long tradition of masculine display that was often effeminate and implicitly queer, evocations of that tradition are not generally seen within rock culture as celebrations of rock authenticity.
fields.author: PHILIP AUSLANDER, Performing Glam Rock: Gender and Theatricality in Popular Music

fields.quote: Rock-and-roll works because we're all a bunch of flakes. That's something you can depend on, and a good thing too, because in the twentieth century, that's all there is: jazz and rock-and-roll. The rest is term papers and advertising.
fields.author: DAVE HICKEY, Air Guitar: Essays on Art and Democracy

fields.quote: Rock 'n' roll starts between the legs and goes through the heart, then to the head. As long as it does those three things, it's a great rock song.
fields.author: JOHN COUGAR MELLENCAMP, interview, Spin Magazine, February 1992

fields.quote: It is too simplistic to say that rock and roll is nothing more than rhythm and blues played by people whose ancestors came from Europe rather than Africa. It does not go too far, though, to say that rhythm and blues and rock and roll bridged the gap between black and white culture in ways that jazz only hinted at.
fields.author: JEFF WALLENFELDT, The Birth of Rock & Roll: Music in the 1950s Through the 1960s

fields.quote: It's only rock 'n' roll but I like it.
fields.author: ROLLING STONES, "It's Only Rock'n'Roll (But I Like It)"

fields.quote: My my, hey heyRock and roll is here to stayIt's better to burn outThan to fade awayHey hey, my myRock and roll can never dieThere's more to the pictureThan meets the eye
fields.author: NEIL YOUNG, "Out of the Blue"

fields.quote: In truth, [rock 'n' roll] has no beginning and no end, for it is the very pulse of life itself.
fields.author: LARRY WILLIAMS, attributed, Rock from the Beginning

fields.quote: Rock and roll doesn't necessarily mean a band. It doesn't mean a singer, and it doesn't mean a lyric, really. It's that question of trying to be immortal.
fields.author: MALCOLM MCLAREN, attributed, The New Penguin Dictionary of Modern Quotations

fields.quote: We imagined ourselves as the Sons of Liberty with a mission to preserve, protect, and project the revolutionary spirit of rock and roll. We feared that the music which had given us sustenance was in danger of spiritual starvation. We feared it losing its sense of purpose, we feared it falling into fattened hands, we feared it floundering in a mire of spectacle, finance, and vapid technical complexity.
fields.author: PATTI SMITH, Just Kids

fields.quote: Rock and roll is not a musical genre; it is a communal spirit.
fields.author: GAIL BUCKLAND, Who Shot Rock & Roll: A Photographic History, 1955 to the Present

fields.quote: They say the heart of rock and roll is still beatingAnd from what I've seen I believe 'emNow the old boy may be barely breathingBut the heart of rock and roll, heart of rock and roll is still beating
fields.author: HUEY LEWIS & THE NEWS, "The Heart of Rock and Roll", Sports

fields.quote: Rock and roll is a nuclear blast of reality in a mundane world where no-one is allowed to be magnificent.
fields.author: KIM FOWLEY, attributed, "50 More Rock'N'Roll Quotes", Clash Magazine, May 1, 2009

fields.quote: Singing, I love rock and rollSo put another dime in the jukebox, babyI love rock and rollSo come and take your time and dance with meOw!
fields.author: JOAN JETT AND THE BLACKHEARTS, "I Love Rock 'N' Roll"

fields.quote: Rock and Roll: Music for the neck downwards.
fields.author: KEITH RICHARDS, attributed, Rock & Roll Facts, Figures & Fun

fields.quote: Real, undiluted rock-and-roll is almost by definition the province of a dissident minority (larger at some times than at others); it achieved its cultural hegemony in the sixties only by becoming rock--by absorbing competing cultural values and in turn being absorbed, making a new rebellion necessary.
fields.author: ELLEN WILLIS, Beginning to See the Light: Sex, Hope, and Rock-And-Roll

fields.quote: In fact rock, rather than being an example of how freedom can be achieved within the capitalist structure, is an example of how capitalism can, almost without conscious effort, deceive those whom it oppresses.... So effective has the rock industry been in encouraging the spirit of optimistic youth take-over that rock's truly hard political edge, its constant exploration of the varieties of youthful frustration, has been ignored and softened.
fields.author: MICHAEL LYDON, attributed, The Sociology of Rock

fields.quote: A missive to all you metal bands, the world is totally over the rock thing. Rock is deader than it's ever been.
fields.author: BILLY CORGAN, attributed, "50 More Rock'N'Roll Quotes", Clash Magazine, May 1, 2009

fields.quote: Hey kids, where are you?Nobody tells you what to do, babyHey kids, rock and rollNobody tells you where to go, baby, baby, baby
fields.author: R.E.M., "Drive", Automatic for the People

fields.quote: Rock and roll is the music of America, of youth, of rebellion, and of the common spirit that ties all that together.
fields.author: TOM LARSON, History of Rock and Roll

fields.quote: Most rock journalism is people who can't write, interviewing people who can't talk, for people who can't read.
fields.author: FRANK ZAPPA, attributed, The Year the Music Died: 1964-1972

fields.quote: I thought rock and roll was an unassailable outlet for some pure and natural expression of rebellion. It used to be one channel you could take without ever havin' to kiss arse, you know?
fields.author: KEITH RICHARDS, BBC News, April 4, 2007

fields.quote: It is an essential sign of the popularity of rock and roll that it constantly marks its difference from other musical cultures, whether popular or not. Rock and roll is, from its own side, not merely a subset of "pop," and there must always be music that is not rock and roll. Such "other" music is "co-opted," "sold out," "bubblegum," "family entertainment," and so on.
fields.author: LAWRENCE GROSSBERG, Dancing in Spite of Myself: Essays on Popular Culture

fields.quote: No matter how long you play rock and roll, songs might change just as long as the balls are there, the rock balls. And that's what's important to us.
fields.author: BON SCOTT, interview, Record Review, 1979

fields.quote: When they play their music, that hard rock musicThey like it with a lot of flashBut it's still that same old back beat rhythmThat really kicks 'em in the....
fields.author: HUEY LEWIS & THE NEWS, "The Heart of Rock and Roll", Sports

fields.quote: We're just going to play rock and roll and not do anything else; we're going to stay in our rooms, and the world is a nasty, horrible place because it didn't give us everything we cried for. Right?
fields.author: JOHN LENNON, attributed, The Beatles: A Recording History

fields.quote: Rock'n'roll has never been about being stupid. And people who were, were perceived as being stupid and no longer make records. Stupid is the wrong word. Careless, reckless, I think are the correct words to use.
fields.author: JOHN COUGAR MELLENCAMP, interview, Spin Magazine, February 1992

fields.quote: Rock and roll is a music, and why should a music contribute to ... juvenile delinquency? If people are going to be juvenile delinquents, they're going to be delinquents if they hear ... Mother Goose rhymes.
fields.author: ELVIS PRESLEY, attributed, "The All American Boy: Enter Elvis and the Rock-a-billies", Pop Chronicles

fields.quote: The most persistent myth was the one that categorized rock and roll as rebellious and anti-Establishment. Forget the fact that it was a myth to begin with ... but now? Rock and roll is so much a part of the Establishment these days that it is difficult to keep up the pretense.
fields.author: PAUL COLBY, The Bitter End: Hanging Out at America's Nightclub

fields.quote: I hope the guy who came up with the phrase "sex, drugs and rock 'n' roll" rots in hell, I'd like to change it so it makes more sense: "sex death and rock 'n' roll".
fields.author: GENE SIMMONS, attributed, "50 More Rock'N'Roll Quotes", Clash Magazine, May 1, 2009

fields.quote: From this moment on I'd dedicate my life to rock and roll and take as many drugs as possible. What could possibly go wrong?
fields.author: CRAIG FERGUSON, American on Purpose: The Improbable Adventures of an Unlikely Patriot

fields.quote: As I define it, rock and roll is dead. The attitude isn't dead, but the music is no longer vital. It doesn't have the same meaning. The attitude, though, is still very much alive -- and it still informs other kinds of music.
fields.author: DAVID BYRNE, Rolling Stone, December 13, 1990

fields.quote: Rock-and-roll, on the other hand, presumes that the four of us--as damaged and anti-social as we are--might possibly get it to-fucking-gether, man, and play this simple song. And play it right, okay? Just this once, in tune and on the beat. But we can't. The song's too simple, and we're too complicated and too excited. We try like hell, but the guitars distort, the intonation bends, and the beat just moves, imperceptibly, against our formal expectations, whether we want it to or not. Just because we're breathing, man. Thus, in the process of trying to play this very simple song together, we create this hurricane of noise, this infinitely complicated, fractal filigree of delicate distinctions.
fields.author: DAVE HICKEY, Air Guitar: Essays on Art and Democracy

fields.quote: Rock-and-rollers seem to accept their minority status as given and even to revel in it. Which poses an enormous contradiction, for real rock-and-roll almost by definition aspires to convert the world.
fields.author: ELLEN WILLIS, Beginning to See the Light: Sex, Hope, and Rock-And-Roll

fields.quote: Sex and drugs and rock and rollIs all my brain and body need.Sex and drugs and rock and rollIs very good indeed.
fields.author: IAN DURY, "Sex and Drugs and Rock and Roll"

fields.quote: Every performer who ever performed rock and roll or even close to it is lying if they tell you that they weren't influenced in some way or another by Elvis Presley. He turned the world around.
fields.author: MAC DAVIS, attributed, e-leetspeak

fields.quote: Hail, hail rock and rollDeliver me from the days of oldLong live rock and rollThe beat of the drums, loud and boldRock, rock, rock and rollThe feelin' is there, body and soul
fields.author: CHUCK BERRY, "School Days", After School Session

fields.quote: Long live rock, I need it every night.Long live rock, come on and join the line.Long live rock, be it dead or alive.
fields.author: PETE TOWNSHEND, "Long Live Rock"

fields.quote: I knew the bride when she used to rock and roll.
fields.author: NICK LOWE, "I Knew the Bride"

fields.quote: Hypodermics on the shores, China's under martial lawRock and Roller Cola wars, I can't take it anymore
fields.author: BILLY JOEL, "We Didn't Start the Fire"

fields.quote:
DC, San Antone and the Liberty Town, Boston and Baton RougeTulsa, Austin, Oklahoma City, Seattle, San Francisco, tooEverywhere there's music, real live music, bands with a million stylesBut It's still that some old rock and roll music
that really really drives 'em wild
fields.author: HUEY LEWIS & THE NEWS, "The Heart of Rock and Roll", Sports

fields.quote: In the end, Rock 'n' Roll will save us all.
fields.author: ANONYMOUS

fields.quote: Rock and Roll is as old and dusty as an unloved museum piece. A quick scan of your radio dial will reveal nothing but bands from the distant past ... or bands trading on nostalgia for different sets of glory days. It is a genre encased in amber, with Led Zeppelins and Soundgardens replacing the unlucky mosquito.
fields.author: ALEX GALBRAITH, "From Zero To Guitar Hero, Meet The Small-Town Musician Who's Well On His Way", Uproxx, February 4, 2016

fields.quote: It's been a long time since I rock and rolled,It's been a long time since I did the Stroll.Ooh, let me get it back, let me get it back,Let me get it back, baby, where I come from.It's been a long time, been a long time,Been a long lonely, lonely, lonely, lonely, lonely time. Yes it has.
fields.author: LED ZEPPELIN, "Rock and Roll"

fields.quote: Apple's [music] suggestions are not from your buddy in a band, your cool uncle who is a walking rock and roll encyclopedia, or a friend who runs an indie-rock show at the local university radio station. Instead you've signed up for the most soulless, artless, corporate-earworm-driven music agenda imaginable.
fields.author: KRISTY LOYE, "Rock and Roll is Dead, and Even Axl & Slash Can't Save It", Houston Press, January 5, 2016

fields.quote: Rock and roll is a style in which, at least ostensibly, the best artists are rule breakers.
fields.author: STEVE WAKSMAN, "Women Rock: sexism and music go together like rock and roll", Valley Advocate, January 27, 2016

fields.quote: Rock and roll is a tough genre right now, particularly for purists. Without big synths and horns and auto-tune, what does the genre really have to say right now? Not many bands are able to write rock tunes that feel contemporary. They tend to turn out nostalgic, treacly or, the opposite, preachy.
fields.author: EMILY PATRICK, "Heartless Bastards play a special show for Asheville", Asheville Citizen-Times, February 23, 2016

fields.quote: This is the failing of the digital age: we are no longer creating any new rock heroes. The days of the titans are gone. Music stores are bankrupt, MTV is dead, a world tour no longer means anything when you can watch it on YouTube for free. Fans have destroyed music by trading in Buddy Rich for a drum machine on an iPhone.
fields.author: KRISTY LOYE, "Rock and Roll is Dead, and Even Axl & Slash Can't Save It", Houston Press, January 5, 2016

fields.quote: We're here to re-dedicate you to The Power, The Passion, The Mystery, and The Ministry of Rock and Roll.
fields.author: BRUCE SPRINGSTEEN, Guitar Magazine, July 1999
